It’s disrespectful to the service and time federal employees devote to our country. Time has come for us reopen the government and leave debate  for border security to regular order.

Using hundreds of thousands of federal workers – including members of the @USCG working on the Great Lakes, and @TSA  & @CBP agents keeping  airports, borders safe – as pawns is no way to run the government.
Every single Democrat agrees keeping our nation secure is our number one  priority. Let’s debate in Congress, on the floor and in committee, the best ways to keep our borders secure.
As this unnecessary shutdown continues, the President needs to show leadership by reopening the government.
Merry Christmas and happy holidays to everyone celebrating! John and I send best wishes for a joyful day spent with loved ones.
The American people expect their government to work for them and listen.  It’s the holiday season, we should be showing America our better selves not driving the nation into a pointless shutdown.
A government shutdown is unacceptable. It’s a lack of leadership from President Trump and Republican Congressional Leaders.
A wall is a symbol of division and hatred. We can all agree we need to keep our nation secure, but we must look at innovative technologies and border security — not a wall.

Today’s MDEQ report highlights the need for EPA to set one national protective standard for the entire class of PFAS chemicals.

Many in our community have questions about PFAS and its presence in our waters. Michigan has been hit hard, and this chemical is a threat to human health and our environment wherever it is found, whether in drinking water, air, food, or consumer products.

Now it is even clearer that the Trump Administration's proposal on fuel economy standards was designed to help one group - Big Oil. Congress has taken a small step to give employees on Capitol Hill a transparent and fair process for reporting sexual harassment claims. This is just the first of many much-needed reforms to ensure that workplaces across the country are safe and inclusive for all workers.
Everyone should work in a safe and supportive environment. For too many people, earning a living also includes harassment or discrimination.
Now it’s the House’s turn to debate and consider ending US military involvement in Yemen. https://twitter.com/washingtonpost/status/1073310186255892480 …

People are starving, homes have been bombed, diseases – including a cholera epidemic – are rampant, and too many have been lost to a reckless Saudi-led aerial bombing campaign. Congress has a moral responsibility to end the war in Yemen.

For the third time, the House has shut down debate by quietly sneaking it into a procedural vote. Today, House members received an update from military and diplomatic officials. Families in my hometown are telling me about horrific conditions.

The ongoing war in Yemen has caused endless suffering and is a serious humanitarian crisis. The decision to send the military to war is perhaps one of Congress’ greatest responsibilities. The Senate is having the debate the House should also be having.

My heart goes out to Jessica's family and everyone at @Fox2News.

AI & machine learning systems train on huge data sets that help us advance the tech. But we must ask critical questions to ensure we are balancing privacy with innovation.
We also need clear rules of the road. This technology is changing rapidly. AI has potential to ripple through our economy and create good-paying jobs.
We can’t be scared by AI. It’s going to be developed by someone, and we need to be doing everything we can to make sure it’s developed at home in the US. #Axios360
